intro: Matricaria monspeliensis, commonly known as the Egyptian chamomile, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its flowers are used in traditional medicine for their calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
